result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Lynn Young

defendant.name: Young, Rebecca Lynn

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Rebecca Lynn Young.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
If a waiver, can be by zoom
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:37 AM Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Rebecca Lynn Young.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by video, in custody.  Also appearing by zoom is Attorney Annie Getsinger from the PD's office.
BY THE COURT:  Court will quash the warrant on the appearance today.
Atty Burdon questions whether defendant has contacted the PD's office and if she qualifies.  Atty Getsinger states she did call earlier and does qualify.  States she doesn't have a good reason that defendant didn't appear besides she's never been in trouble.  
Atty Burdon requests signature bond be reinstated.  No objection by Atty Getsinger.
BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate the signature bond and set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young not in court. 
Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by phone. 
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant has not called the Public Defender's office.  Court is going to proceed today since it has been since February and the defendant has not done anything regarding an Attorney yet.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court questions time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:25 AM Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone.  Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant wasn't able to get an attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Court gives the Public Defender phone number
reset
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:37 PM Defendant Rebecca Lynn Young appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an Attorney.
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
